body_html:
Yes of course, the target/output sequence is shorter than the input sequence. But for every "target timestep" you have a label, right?
Im probably misunderstanding what labels represents. In the docs it says:
labels.indices[i, :] == [b, t] means labels.values[i] stores the id for (batch b, time t).
Is not t here in the output time scale?

Im probably misunderstanding what labels represents.  In the docs it says:

Is not t here in the output time scale?
body:
Yes of course, the target/output sequence is shorter than the input sequence. But for every "target timestep" you have a label, right?
Im probably misunderstanding what `labels` represents.  In the docs it says:
`labels.indices[i, :] == [b, t]` means `labels.values[i]` stores the id for (batch b, time t). 
Is not t here in the output time scale?
